00046 #ifndef _CVMX_GLOBAL_RESOURCES_T_
00047 #define _CVMX_GLOBAL_RESOURCES_T_
00048 
00049 #define CVMX_GLOBAL_RESOURCES_DATA_NAME "cvmx-global-resources"
00050 
00051 /*In macros below abbreviation GR stands for global resources. */
00052 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_INVALID cvmx_get_gr_tag('i','n','v','a','l','i','d','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.')
00053 /*Tag for pko que table range. */
00054 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_PKO_QUEUES cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','p','k','o','_','q','u','e','u','s','.','.','.')
00055 /*Tag for a pko internal ports range */
00056 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_PKO_IPORTS cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','p','k','o','_','i','p','o','r','t','.','.','.')
00057 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_FPA        cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','f','p','a','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.')
00058 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_FAU        cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','f','a','u','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.','.')
00059 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_SSO_GRP(n) cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','s','s','o','_','0',(n)+'0','.','.','.','.','.','.');
00060 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_TIM(n)     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','t','i','m','_',(n)+'0','.','.','.','.','.','.','.')
00061 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_CLUSTERS(x)     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','c','l','u','s','t','e','r','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.')
00062 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_CLUSTER_GRP(x)  cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','c','l','g','r','p','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.','.','.')
00063 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_STYLE(x)        cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','s','t','y','l','e','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.','.','.')
00064 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_QPG_ENTRY(x)    cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','q','p','g','e','t','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.','.','.')
00065 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_BPID(x)         cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','b','p','i','d','s','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.','.','.')
00066 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_MTAG_IDX(x)     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','m','t','a','g','x','_',(x+'0'),'.','.','.','.','.')
00067 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_PCAM(x,y,z) \
00068     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','p','c','a','m','_',(x+'0'),(y+'0'),(z+'0'),'.','.','.','.')
00069 
00070 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_CIU3_IDT(_n) \
00071     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','c','i','u','3','_', ((_n) + '0'),'_','i','d','t','.','.')
00072 
00073 
00074 /* Allocation of the 512 SW INTSTs (in the  12 bit SW INTSN space) */
00075 #define CVMX_GR_TAG_CIU3_SWINTSN(_n) \
00076     cvmx_get_gr_tag('c','v','m','_','c','i','u','3','_', ((_n) + '0'),'_','s','w','i','s','n')
00077 
00078 #define TAG_INIT_PART(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H) ( \
00079     (((uint64_t)(A) & 0xff) << 56) | (((uint64_t)(B) & 0xff) << 48) | (((uint64_t)(C) & 0xff) << 40)  | (((uint64_t)(D) & 0xff) << 32) | \
00080     (((uint64_t)(E) & 0xff) << 24) | (((uint64_t)(F) & 0xff) << 16) | (((uint64_t)(G) & 0xff) << 8)   | (((uint64_t)(H) & 0xff)))
00081 
00082 struct global_resource_tag
00083 {
00084     uint64_t lo;
00085     uint64_t hi;
00086 };
00087 
00088 enum cvmx_resource_err
00089 {
00090     CVMX_RESOURCE_ALLOC_FAILED = -1,
00091     CVMX_RESOURCE_ALREADY_RESERVED = -2
00092 };
00093 
00094 /*
00095  * @INTERNAL
00096  * Creates a tag from the specified characters.
00097  */
00098 static inline struct global_resource_tag
00099 cvmx_get_gr_tag(char a, char b, char c, char d, char e, char f, char g, char h,
00100         char i, char j, char k, char l, char m, char n, char o, char p)
00101 {
00102     struct global_resource_tag tag;
00103     tag.lo =  TAG_INIT_PART(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00104     tag.hi =  TAG_INIT_PART(i,j,k,l,m,n,o,p);
00105     return tag;
00106 }
00107 
00108 static inline int cvmx_gr_same_tag(struct global_resource_tag gr1, struct global_resource_tag gr2)
00109 {
00110     return (gr1.hi == gr2.hi) && (gr1.lo == gr2.lo);
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*
00114  * @INTERNAL
00115  * Creates a global resource range that can hold the specified number of
00116  * elements
00117  * @param tag is the tag of the range. The taga is created using the method
00118  * cvmx_get_gr_tag()
00119  * @param nelements is the number of elements to be held in the resource range.
00120  */
00121 int cvmx_create_global_resource_range(struct global_resource_tag tag,int nelements);
00122 
00123 /*
00124  * @INTERNAL
00125  * Allocate nelements in the global resource range with the specified tag. It
00126  * is assumed that prior
00127  * to calling this the global resource range has already been created using
00128  * cvmx_create_global_resource_range().
00129  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00130  * @param nelements is the number of elements to be allocated.
00131  * @param owner is a 64 bit number that identifes the owner of this range.
00132  * @aligment specifes the required alignment of the returned base number.
00133  * @return returns the base of the allocated range. -1 return value indicates
00134  * failure.
00135  */
00136 int cvmx_allocate_global_resource_range(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00137                     uint64_t owner, int nelements,
00138                     int alignment);
00139 
00140 /*
00141  * @INTERNAL
00142  * Allocate nelements in the global resource range with the specified tag.
00143  * The elements allocated need not be contiguous. It is assumed that prior to
00144  * calling this the global resource range has already
00145  * been created using cvmx_create_global_resource_range().
00146  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00147  * @param nelements is the number of elements to be allocated.
00148  * @param owner is a 64 bit number that identifes the owner of the allocated
00149  * elements.
00150  * @param allocated_elements returns indexs of the allocated entries.
00151  * @return returns 0 on success and -1 on failure.
00152  */
00153 int cvmx_resource_alloc_many(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00154                  uint64_t owner,
00155                  int nelements,
00156                  int allocated_elements[]);
00157 int cvmx_resource_alloc_reverse(struct global_resource_tag, uint64_t owner);
00158 /*
00159  * @INTERNAL
00160  * Reserve nelements starting from base in the global resource range with the
00161  * specified tag.
00162  * It is assumed that prior to calling this the global resource range has
00163  * already been created using cvmx_create_global_resource_range().
00164  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00165  * @param nelements is the number of elements to be allocated.
00166  * @param owner is a 64 bit number that identifes the owner of this range.
00167  * @base specifies the base start of nelements.
00168  * @return returns the base of the allocated range. -1 return value indicates
00169  * failure.
00170  */
00171 int cvmx_reserve_global_resource_range(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00172                        uint64_t owner, int base, int nelements);
00173 /*
00174  * @INTERNAL
00175  * Free nelements starting at base in the global resource range with the
00176  * specified tag.
00177  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00178  * @param base is the base number
00179  * @param nelements is the number of elements that are to be freed.
00180  * @return returns 0 if successful and -1 on failure.
00181  */
00182 int cvmx_free_global_resource_range_with_base(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00183                              int base, int nelements);
00184 
00185 
00186 /*
00187  * @INTERNAL
00188  * Free nelements with the bases specified in bases[] with the
00189  * specified tag.
00190  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00191  * @param bases is an array containing the bases to be freed.
00192  * @param nelements is the number of elements that are to be freed.
00193  * @return returns 0 if successful and -1 on failure.
00194  */
00195 int cvmx_free_global_resource_range_multiple(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00196                          int bases[], int nelements);
00197 /*
00198  * @INTERNAL
00199  * Free elements from the specified owner in the global resource range with the
00200  * specified tag.
00201  * @param tag is the tag of the global resource range.
00202  * @param owner is the owner of resources that are to be freed.
00203  * @return returns 0 if successful and -1 on failure.
00204  */
00205 int cvmx_free_global_resource_range_with_owner(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00206                            int owner);
00207 
00208 /*
00209  * @INTERNAL
00210  * Frees all the global resources that have been created.
00211  * For use only from the bootloader, when it shutdown and boots up the
00212  * application or kernel.
00213  */
00214 int free_global_resources(void);
00215 
00216 uint64_t cvmx_get_global_resource_owner(struct global_resource_tag tag,
00217                     int base);
00218 /*
00219  * @INTERNAL
00220  * Shows the global resource range with the specified tag. Use mainly for debug.
00221  */
00222 void  cvmx_show_global_resource_range(struct global_resource_tag tag);
00223 
00224 /*
00225  * @INTERNAL
00226  * Shows all the global resources. Used mainly for debug.
00227  */
00228 void cvmx_global_resources_show(void);
00229 
00230 uint64_t cvmx_allocate_app_id(void);
00231 uint64_t cvmx_get_app_id(void);
00232 
00233 #endif
